channel.title: story on Jef Claes
channel.description: Recent content in story on Jef Claes

item.title: From human decisions, to suggestions to automated decisions
item.description: I’ve been wanting to share this experience for a while, but it took me a while to come up with a story and example I could use in a blog post. I help out during the weekends in a small family run magic shop. I’m the third generation working in the shop. My great-grandfather always hoped that his only son would follow in his footsteps as a carpenter. But at only eighteen years old, my grandfather said goodbye to the chisels and sawdust, and set out for the big city to chase his dream of becoming a world class magician.

item.title: Eventual consistency in the Wild West
item.description: San Francisco, 1852. With the California Gold Rush at its peak, successful gold-seekers wanted to protect all their precious gold nuggets by storing them in a strong safe. At the time, it wasn’t that easy to have access to a safe though. At the very beginning, it were just a few local merchants that owned one. Not much later, bankers swamped the area hoping to get their piece of the pie - bringing the strongest safes money can buy.
